result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Noelle M Schneider

records.addlTxt: Hearing on November 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
conditions modified on 10/24/22

NEW CONDITIONS ORDERED ON 10/24/2022:  Court orders removal of CAM monitoring, but if there are any positive tests the Court orders that CAM monitoring can be immediately reinstated.

PREVIOUSLY ISSUED CONDITIONS:  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level *2, 3 or 4 supervision.

1:48 PM; Case called for Bail/bond hearing.   Defendant Noelle M Schneider in court.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Noelle M Schneider.  Prosecuting attorney Molly M Schmidt in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Court notes the matter is before the Court with respect to Defense Motion to Modify Bail but also notes an Amended Information was filed adding Count 2.  Atty. Wolff acknowledges receipt, waives reading and enters initial not guilty plea.  Atty. Wolff presents arguments; he is asking that SCRAM monitoring be removed, but ok with leaving WCS monitoring.  State takes no position.  For reasons placed on the record the Court will grant Defendant's Motion to Modify Bail; Court will order that SCRAM be removed as of 11/01/2022 but will order that WCS monitoring remain in place, noting if there are any positive results SCRAM can be immediately put back on.  Atty. Wolff provides an update with respect to the case and is requesting one more further proceedings date in about 30-45 days.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for November 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Bail/bond hearing on October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defense Motion for Bail Modification filed by Atty. Wolff.
Laboratory report filed by the State.
Hearing on October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

9:34 AM; Case called for Hearing.   Prosecuting attorney Jack A. Pitzo in court for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant Noelle M Schneider in court.  Attorney Peter M Wolff in court for Noelle M Schneider.  Atty. Wolff provides an update, he needs additional time to begin an investigation and discuss the case with the ADA assigned.  Atty. Wolff requests a further proceedings date in about 45 days.  No objection by the State.  Court adjourns for further proceedings.
Hearing scheduled for October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Hearing on September 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Filed by Atty. Wolff.

records.addlTxt: Defendant waives her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

09:14 AM Defendant Noelle M Schneider in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.  Peter Michael Tempelis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Court finds that the Defendants waiver to a preliminary hearing is knowing and voluntary.  Waive reading of Information.  NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:30 am.
Effective August 1, 2022, this case is assigned to Branch 7 Judicial Vacancy, pursuant to 22-SO-04(67).
Filed by Atty Peter Wolff

Adjustment Number: 22A 027350,
Payable Number: 469547,
Receipt Number: 22R 029301,
Amount: $20.00
Preliminary hearing on August 3, 2022 at 09:15 am.

01:28 PM Defendant Noelle M Schneider in court with attorney Peter M Wolff.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 3, 2022 at 09:15 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Noelle M Schneider
Current: 515 W Moreland Blvd, c/o Waukesha County Jail, Waukesha, WI 53188 United States  (Effective: 07-01-2022)
Prior: 287 Stonefield Dr, Lake Mills, WI 53551
Hearing on July 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing.  Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.   Defendant is not to enter any premises, other than a grocery store, that sells/serves alcohol beverages by the drink or into any liquor store. Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant is not to use/possess any drug paraphernalia.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.  Comply with all licensing restrictions.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program under Level *2, 3 or 4 supervision.  The defendant is ordered to comply with CAM monitoring through WCS.  CAM duration shall remain until further order of the court. Defendant to pay costs associated with CAM.  The Defendant to report to WCS by end of business on July 05, 2022.

02:52 PM Defendant Noelle M Schneider in court, in custody, with State Public Defender Law Intern.   Attorney appears as friend of the court.  District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Defense acknowledges receipt of complaint and waives reading of complaint.  
Service admitted/advised of charges and potential penalties.  
Court advises of right to an attorney.  Defendant to seek counsel.
Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing.  Hearing scheduled for July 8, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
WCS Pre-trial Report
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection and Notice of Intent to Use Defendant's Statement and DNA Evidence.
